snippet: The Burmese opposition leader Daw Aung San Suu Kyi spoke of the hope her award kindled in 1991, when she was under house arrest.
abstract: Burmese opposition leader Daw Aung San Suu Kyi speaks of the hope her award kindled in 1991, when she was under house arrest in Myanmar, as she finally accepts her Nobel Peace Prize in Oslo.
lead_paragraph: The Burmese opposition leader Daw Aung San Suu Kyi spoke of the hope her award kindled in 1991, when she was under house arrest.

headline.seo: Aung San Suu Kyi Accepts Nobel Peace Prize
headline.main: In Long-Overdue Speech, Dissident Says Nobel Opened Her Heart
headline.print_headline: In Long-Overdue Speech, Dissident Says Nobel Opened Her Heart
